page.title: 19VILLAGE LIFE-BLEWBURY
page.content: BLEWBURY IS A VILLAGE MADE UP OF TWO COMMUNITIES.THERE ARE THE PEOPLE BORN AND BRED THERE,WHO MAINLY COME FROM GENERATIONS OF FARMING PEOPLE AND THE 'NEWCOMERS'MAINLY PROFESSIONAL PEOPLE SUCH AS SCIENTISTS,TEACHERS,MUSICIANS PHYSICISTS AND OTHERS,WHO HAVE COME TO LIVE IN THE VILLAGE FROM OTHER PARTS OF THE COUNTRY.WHILE THE 'NATIVES'WANT TO KEEP THE VILLAGE AS IT WAS FOR MANY YEARS,THE 'NEWCOMERS'ARE GRADUALLY CHANGING THE OUTLOOK OF THE PLACE BY THE BUILDING OF MODERN HOUSES AND THE BUSY SOCIAL LIFE THEY CREATE. THERE IS AN APPOINTED PARISH COUNCIL, CONSISTING OF ELEVEN MEMBERS.THEY MEET OFFICIALLY ONCE A MONTH,WITH OCCASIONAL SUB.COMMITTEES,AS THE NEED ARISES. MATTERS UNDER DISCUSSION INCLUDE PLANNING OF NEW BUILDING,RENOVATIONS OF OLD ONES,MAINTAINANCE OF FOOTPATHS AND GENERAL COMMUNITY AFFAIRS.
